keyword: how many calories in a turkey burger
title: How Many Calories in a Turkey Burger?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a turkey burger, including protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Turkey Burger?
assumptions: 4 oz ground turkey patty (93% lean), grilled, on a whole wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, and mustard; no cheese or mayo.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by turkey type, patty size, bun brand, toppings, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard turkey burger provides ~320 kcal and ~28 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a turkey burger patty alone?
faqs.a: About 180 kcal for a 4 oz grilled 93% lean patty.

faqs.q: Is a turkey burger lower in calories than beef?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 20-30% fewer calories if lean turkey is used.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a turkey burger?
faqs.a: â‰ˆ28 g protein, 14 g fat, 28 g carbs (including bun).

faqs.q: Does adding mayo increase calories much?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp mayo adds ~90 kcal; opt for mustard or avocado for lighter options.

faqs.q: How does baking vs. grilling affect calories?
faqs.a: Baking may add fewer calories if no oil is used; grilling is similar under assumptions.
